intro: Dendrocolla obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, palmate fronds that can reach up to 3 meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its slow growth and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its rhizome system supports the development of its distinctive, branching structure. Dendrocolla obtusa plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native forests, providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
